tit.e: Tenson Korin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the Sun Goddess)
Tenson Korin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the Sun Goddess)
Tenson Korin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the Sun Goddess)

sen.j: 天孫降臨（てんそんこうりん）は、アマテラスの孫であるニニギが、葦原中国平定を受けて、葦原中国の統治のために降臨したという日本神話の説話である。
sen.e: Tenson Korin is a legend in Japanese mythology, in which the grandson of Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess) Ninigi received the order to pacify Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains) and descended from heaven in order to rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.

Tenson Korin is a legend in Japanese mythology, in which the grandson of Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess) Ninigi received the order to pacify Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains) and descended from heaven in order to rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.

Tenson Korin is a legend in Japanese mythology, in which the grandson of Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess) Ninigi received the order to pacify Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains) and descended from heaven in order to rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.

sen.j: 朝鮮の建国神話、とくに加耶の始祖首露王が亀旨（クジ）峰に天降る話と似ていることが、神話学者の三品彰英によって指摘されている。
sen.e: The fact that it is similar to the mythology of establishing the nation in Korea, the descent of the patriarch of Kaya, Suro-wang, onto Kuji Mountain in particular, has been pointed out by mythologist Shoei MISHINA.

The fact that it is similar to the mythology of establishing the nation in Korea, the descent of the patriarch of Kaya, Suro-wang, onto the Kuji Mountain in particular, has been pointed out by mythologist Shoei MISHINA.

The fact that it is similar to the mythology of establishing the nation in Korea, the descent of the patriarch of Kaya, Suro-wang, onto the Kuji Mountain in particular, has been pointed out by mythologist Shoei MISHINA.

sen.j: ここでは、葦原中国平定の後、ニニギが葦原中国に降臨し、コノハナノサクヤビメとの間に三柱の子を生むまでの日本神話を記す。
sen.e: The story of Ninigi's descent to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni after the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni until the birth of the Three Children between him and Konohanano Sakuyabime is described here.

The story of Ninigi's descent to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni after the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni until the birth of the Three Children between him and Konohanano Sakuyabime is described here.

The story of Ninigi's descent to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni after the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni until the birth of the Three Children between him and Konohanano Sakuyabime is described here.

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Storyline
Storyline
Storyline

sen.j: 天孫ニニギの誕生
sen.e: Birth of Tenson Ninigi
Birth of Tenson Ninigi
Birth of Tenson Ninigi

sen.j: アマテラスとタカミムスビは、アマテラスの子であるアメノオシホミミに、「葦原中国平定が終わったので、以前に委任した通りに、天降って葦原中国を治めなさい」（「今平訖葦原中國矣 故汝當依命下降而統之」『古事記』）と言った。
sen.e: Amaterasu and Takamimusubi said to Amaterasu's child, Amenooshihohomi, 'Now that pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni is done, descend down to earth and rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni as you agreed to do' (the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters)).

Amaterasu and Takamimusubi said to Amaterasu's child, Amenooshihohomi, 'Now that pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni is done, descend to earth and rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni as you agreed to do' (the "Kojiki" [The Records of Ancient Matters]).
sen.cmt: descendだけで意味を十分になすのでdownを削除()内の()を[ ]に変更
sen.e: Amaterasu and Takamimusubi said to Amaterasu's child, Amenooshihohomi, 'Now that pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni is done, descend to earth and rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni as you agreed to do' (the "Kojiki" [The Records of Ancient Matters]).

sen.j: アメノオシホミミは、「天降りの準備をしている間に、子のニニギが生まれたので、この子を降すべきでしょう」（「僕者將降裝束之間 生一子 其名天邇岐志國邇岐志天津日高日子番能邇邇藝命 此子應降也」『古事記』）と答えた。
sen.e: Amenooshihohomi replied, 'Because my child Ninigi was born as I was preparing to descend down on earth, this child should be send to earth' (the "Kojiki").
Amenooshihohomi replied, 'Because my child Ninigi was born as I was preparing to descend to earth, this child should be send to earth' (the "Kojiki").
Amenooshihohomi replied, 'Because my child Ninigi was born as I was preparing to descend to earth, this child should be send to earth' (the "Kojiki").

sen.j: ニニギは高木神の娘の栲幡千千姫命との間の子である。
sen.e: Ninigi was a child between Amenooshihohomi and Takuhatachijihime no mikoto, a daughter of Takagi no kami.
Ninigi was a child between Amenooshihohomi and Takuhatachijihime no mikoto, a daughter of Takagi no kami.
Ninigi was a child between Amenooshihohomi and Takuhatachijihime no mikoto, a daughter of Takagi no kami.

sen.j: それで二神は、ニニギに葦原中国の統治を委任し、天降りを命じた。
sen.e: The two gods entrusted Ninigi with the ruling of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and they ordered him to descend down to earth.
The two gods entrusted Ninigi with the ruling of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and they ordered him to descend to earth.
sen.cmt: descendだけで意味を十分になすのでdownを削除
sen.e: The two gods entrusted Ninigi with the ruling of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and they ordered him to descend to earth.

sen.j: サルタヒコ
sen.e: Sarutahiko
Sarutahiko
Sarutahiko

sen.j: ニニギが天降りをしようとすると、天の八衢（やちまた）に、高天原から葦原中国までを照らす神がいた。
sen.e: When Ninigi was about to descend down to earth there was a god in Yachimata who shined light from Takamanohara (plain of high heaven) to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.
When Ninigi was about to descend to earth there was a god in Yachimata who shined light from Takamanohara (plain of high heaven) to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.
sen.cmt: descendだけで意味を十分になすのでdownを削除
sen.e: When Ninigi was about to descend to earth there was a god in Yachimata who shined light from Takamanohara (plain of high heaven) to Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.

sen.j: そこでアマテラスと高木神はアメノウズメに、その神の元へ行って誰であるか尋ねるよう命じた。
sen.e: Therefore, Amaterasu and Takagi no kami ordered Amenouzume to go to that god and to ask who he was.
Therefore, Amaterasu and Takagi no kami ordered Amenouzume to go to that god and to ask who he was.
Therefore, Amaterasu and Takagi no kami ordered Amenouzume to go to that god and to ask who he was.

sen.j: その神は国津神のサルタヒコであった。
sen.e: This god was Sarutahiko, a Kunitsukami (god of the land).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This god was Sarutahiko, a Kunitsukami (god of the land).
sen.cmt: Kunitsukami (god of the land). のスペースを削除
sen.e: This god was Sarutahiko, a Kunitsukami (god of the land).

sen.j: 天津神の御子が天降りすると聞いて先導をしようと迎えに来たのであった。
sen.e: He heard that a child of Amatsukami (god of heaven) would descend on earth so he came to lead his way.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He heard that a child of Amatsukami (god of heaven) would descend to earth so he came to lead his way.
He heard that a child of Amatsukami (god of heaven) would descend to earth so he came to lead his way.

sen.j: 天孫降臨
sen.e: Tenson Korin
Tenson Korin
Tenson Korin

sen.j: アメノコヤネ、フトダマ、アメノウズメ、イシコリドメ、タマノオヤの五伴緒（いつとものお）を従えさせ、天降りをすることになった。
sen.e: It was decided that the descend down to earth would be accompanied by Itsutomonoo (the five attendants), Amenokoyane, Futodama, Amenouzune, Ishikoridome and Tamanooya.
It was decided that the descending to earth would be accompanied by Itsutomonoo (the five attendants) which were Amenokoyane, Futodama, Amenouzune, Ishikoridome and Tamanooya.
sen.cmt: the descendは文法的に間違いなのでdescendingに修正descendだけで意味を十分になすのでdownを削除Itsutomonooの説明がなされていなかったので、コンマを削除し、which wereを挿入
sen.e: It was decided that the descending to earth would be accompanied by Itsutomonoo (the five attendants) which were Amenokoyane, Futodama, Amenouzune, Ishikoridome and Tamanooya.

sen.j: さらに、三種の神器（八尺瓊勾玉、八咫鏡、天叢雲剣）と常世のオモイカネ、タヂカラオ、アメノイワトワケを副え、「この鏡を私（アマテラス）の御魂と思って、私を拝むように敬い祀りなさい。オモイカネは、祭祀を取り扱い神宮の政務を行いなさい」（「邇邇藝命者 此鏡者同我御魂 欲祭此者 當如拜吾前 尊崇而祭之 次 思金神者 取持前事 輔其為政」『古事記』）と言った。
sen.e: Furthermore, he was given the Three Sacred Items (Yasakani no magatama (comma-shaped jewel), Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror), Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (the sword Ame no Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds")) and Omoikane, Tajikarao and Amenoiwatowake from the eternal world to accompany him, and Amaterasu said, 'Think of this mirror as my spirit, enshrine it and worship me. Omoikane, you should be in charge of rituals and take care of the administration of the shrine' (the "Kojiki").

Furthermore, he was given the Three Sacred Items (Yasakani no magatama [comma-shaped jewel], Yata no Kagami [the eight-span mirror], Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi [the sword Ame no Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds"]) and Omoikane, Tajikarao and Amenoiwatowake from the eternal world to accompany him, and Amaterasu said, 'Think of this mirror as my spirit, enshrine it and worship me. Omoikane, you should be in charge of rituals and take care of the administration of the shrine' (the "Kojiki").

Furthermore, he was given the Three Sacred Items (Yasakani no magatama [comma-shaped jewel], Yata no Kagami [the eight-span mirror], Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi [the sword Ame no Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds"]) and Omoikane, Tajikarao and Amenoiwatowake from the eternal world to accompany him, and Amaterasu said, 'Think of this mirror as my spirit, enshrine it and worship me. Omoikane, you should be in charge of rituals and take care of the administration of the shrine' (the "Kojiki").

sen.j: これらの二柱の神は伊勢神宮に祀ってある。
sen.e: These two gods are enshrined at Ise-jingu Shrine.
These two gods are enshrined at Ise-jingu Shrine.
These two gods are enshrined at Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: トヨウケは伊勢神宮の外宮に鎮座している。
sen.e: Toyouke is enshrined in gegu (the outer shrine) at Ise-jingu Shrine.
Toyouke is enshrined in Gegu (the outer shrine) at Ise-jingu Shrine.
Toyouke is enshrined in Gegu (the outer shrine) at Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: アメノイワトワケは、別名をクシイワマト、またはトヨイワマトと言い、御門の神である。
sen.e: Amenoiwatowake's alternate names are Kushiiwamato and Toyoiwamato, and he is Mikado no kami (deity of the gate)
Amenoiwatowake's alternate names are Kushiiwamato and Toyoiwamato, and he is the Mikado no kami (deity of the gate).
sen.cmt: Mikadoの前にtheを挿入ピリオド抜けのためピリオドを挿入
sen.e: Amenoiwatowake's alternate names are Kushiiwamato and Toyoiwamato, and he is the Mikado no kami (deity of the gate).

sen.j: タヂカラオ神は佐那那県（さなながた）に鎮座している。
sen.e: The deity Tajikarao is enshrined in Sananagata.
The deity Tajikarao is enshrined in Sananagata.
The deity Tajikarao is enshrined in Sananagata.

sen.j: アメノコヤネは中臣氏らの祖神である。
sen.e: Amenokoyane is the patriarchal deity of the Nakatomi clan.
Amenokoyane is the patriarchal deity of the Nakatomi clan.
Amenokoyane is the patriarchal deity of the Nakatomi clan.

sen.j: フトダマは忌部氏らの祖神である。
sen.e: Futodama is the patriarchal deity of Inbe clan.
Futodama is the patriarchal deity of Inbe clan.
Futodama is the patriarchal deity of Inbe clan.

sen.j: アメノウズメは猿女氏らの祖神である。
sen.e: Amenouzume is the patriarchal deity of the Sarume clan.
Amenouzume is the patriarchal deity of the Sarume clan.
Amenouzume is the patriarchal deity of the Sarume clan.

sen.j: イシコリドメは作鏡連らの祖神である。
sen.e: Ishikoridome is the patriarchal deity of Kagami Tsukuri no Muraji.
Ishikoridome is the patriarchal deity of Kagami Tsukuri no Muraji.
Ishikoridome is the patriarchal deity of Kagami Tsukuri no Muraji.

sen.j: タマノオヤは玉祖連らの祖神である。
sen.e: Tamanooya is the patriarchal deity of Tamanooya no Muraji.
Tamanooya is the patriarchal deity of Tamanooya no Muraji.
Tamanooya is the patriarchal deity of Tamanooya no Muraji.

sen.j: ニニギは高天原を離れ、天の浮橋から浮島に立ち、筑紫の日向の高千穂の久士布流多気（くじふるたけ）に天降った。
sen.e: Ninigi left Takamanohara, went from Ama no Ukihashi (the heavenly floating bridge) to Uki-shima Island, and he descended on earth at Kujifurutake in Takachiho in Himuka, Chikushi.
Ninigi left Takamanohara, went from Ama no Ukihashi (the heavenly floating bridge) to Uki-shima Island, and he descended to earth at Kujifurutake in Takachiho, Himuka, Chikushi.
sen.cmt: on→toに変更in Himukaの前にinがあるのでin→,コンマに変更
sen.e: Ninigi left Takamanohara, went from Ama no Ukihashi (the heavenly floating bridge) to Uki-shima Island, and he descended to earth at Kujifurutake in Takachiho, Himuka, Chikushi.

sen.j: 降った場所については日本書紀に、ソホリ、二上の山等の記述もある。
sen.e: The site where he descended was noted in the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) as places such as Sohori and Futagami no Yama (Mt. Futagami).
The site where he descended was noted in the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) as places such as Sohori and Futagami no Yama (Mt. Futagami).
The site where he descended was noted in the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) as places such as Sohori and Futagami no Yama (Mt. Futagami).

sen.j: また、日向はヒムカと読み日向国とした記述はない。
sen.e: Himuka was called Himuka, and there is no record of it being Hyuga province.
Himuka was called Himuka, and there is no record of it being Hyuga Province.
Himuka was called Himuka, and there is no record of it being Hyuga Province.

sen.j: アメノオシヒとアマツクメが武装して先導した。
sen.e: Amenooshihi and Amatsukume wore their armors and led the way.
Amenooshihi and Amatsukume wore their armors and led the way.
Amenooshihi and Amatsukume wore their armors and led the way.

sen.j: アメノオシヒは大伴氏らの祖神である。
sen.e: Amenooshihi is the patriarchal deity of the Otomo clan.
Amenooshihi is the patriarchal deity of the Otomo clan.
Amenooshihi is the patriarchal deity of the Otomo clan.

sen.j: アマツクメは久米直らの祖神である。
sen.e: Amatsukume is the patriarchal deity of Kume no Atai.
Amatsukume is the patriarchal deity of Kume no Atai.
Amatsukume is the patriarchal deity of Kume no Atai.

sen.j: ニニギは「この地は韓国（からくに）に向かい、笠沙（かささ）の岬まで真っ直ぐに道が通じていて、朝日のよく射す国、夕日のよく照る国である。それで、ここはとても良い土地である」（「此地者 向韓國 有真之道通笠紗之御前 又此地者 朝日之直刺國 夕日之日照國也 故 此地甚吉地也」『古事記』）と言って、そこに宮殿を建てて住むことにした。
sen.e: Ninigi said, 'This land faces Karakuni (Korea), and there is a direct path to Kasasa no Misaki, and this land receives lots of morning light and lots light from the setting sun. Therefore, this is a very good land' (the "Kojiki"), and he built a palace and decided to live there.

Ninigi said, 'This land faces Karakuni (Korea), and there is a direct path to Kasasa no Misaki, and this land receives lots of morning light and lots light from the setting sun, therefore, this is a very good land' (the "Kojiki"), and he built a palace and decided to live there.
sen.cmt: Therefore→,thereforeに変更し、2つの文を1文にしました。
sen.e: Ninigi said, 'This land faces Karakuni (Korea), and there is a direct path to Kasasa no Misaki, and this land receives lots of morning light and lots light from the setting sun, therefore, this is a very good land' (the "Kojiki"), and he built a palace and decided to live there.

sen.j: 天孫降臨の地としては、九州南部の霧島連峰の一山である「高千穂峰」と、宮崎県高千穂町の双方がある。
sen.e: There are two places for the site of Tenson Korin, 'Takachiho no mine' Mountain, which is one of the mountains in the Kirishima Mountain Range in southern Kyushu, and Takachiho-cho in Miyazaki Prefecture.

There are two places for the site of Tenson Korin, 'Takachiho no mine' Mountain, which is one of the mountains in the Kirishima Mountain Range in southern Kyushu, and Takachiho-cho in Miyazaki Prefecture.

There are two places for the site of Tenson Korin, 'Takachiho no mine' Mountain, which is one of the mountains in the Kirishima Mountain Range in southern Kyushu, and Takachiho-cho in Miyazaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 古くから天孫降臨の言い伝えがある。
sen.e: There are legends of Tenson Korin since the ancient times.
There are legends of Tenson Korin since the ancient times.
There are legends of Tenson Korin since the ancient times.

sen.j: ただ、高千穂峰の場合は山の名称だけで付近に「高千穂」の地名が無い。
sen.e: However, in the case of Takachiho no mine Mountain, there is only the name of the mountain and there is no place name of 'Takachiho.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the case of Takachiho no mine Mountain, there is only the name of the mountain and there is no place name of 'Takachiho'.
sen.cmt: 'Takachiho.'の' '内にあるコンマを外に移動
sen.e: However, in the case of Takachiho no mine Mountain, there is only the name of the mountain and there is no place name of 'Takachiho'.

sen.j: そのため、「宮崎県高千穂町の周辺が正しい」と見る向きもある。
sen.e: Therefore, there is a tendency to view that 'the correct area is around Takachiho-cho, Miyazaki Prefecture.'
Therefore, there is a tendency to view that 'the correct area is around Takachiho-cho, in Miyazaki Prefecture.'
Therefore, there is a tendency to view that 'the correct area is around Takachiho-cho, in Miyazaki Prefecture.'

sen.j: しかし、実際のところは、どちらの場所が正しいかははっきりしていない。
sen.e: However, in reality, there is no definitive answer as to which one is the correct site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in reality, there is no definitive answer as to which one is the correct site.
However, in reality, there is no definitive answer as to which one is the correct site.

sen.j: なお高千穂町には、アマテラスが隠れていた「天岩戸伝説」もあり、実際にその伝説の洞窟も現存する。
sen.e: In Takachiho-cho, there is 'the Legend of Ama no Iwato,' where Amaterasu hid, and the legendary cave also exists in reality,
In Takachiho-cho, there is 'the Legend of Ama no Iwato,' where Amaterasu hid, and the legendary cave also exists in reality,
In Takachiho-cho, there is 'the Legend of Ama no Iwato,' where Amaterasu hid, and the legendary cave also exists in reality,

sen.j: ※注記．天岩戸伝説は高千穂町以外にも複数あり、必ずしも高千穂地区に限定されたものでは無い。
sen.e: Note: The Legend of Ama no Iwato exists in multiple areas besides Takachiho-cho, and it is not necessarily limited to Takachiho-cho region.
Note: The Legend of Ama no Iwato exists in multiple areas besides Takachiho-cho, and it is not necessarily limited to Takachiho-cho region.
Note: The Legend of Ama no Iwato exists in multiple areas besides Takachiho-cho, and it is not necessarily limited to Takachiho-cho region.

sen.j: サルタヒコとアメノウズメ
sen.e: Sarutahiko and Amenouzume
Sarutahiko and Amenouzume
Sarutahiko and Amenouzume

sen.j: ニニギはアメノウズメに、サルタヒコを送り届けて、その神の名を負って仕えるよう言った。
sen.e: Ninigi told Amenouzume to bring Sarutahiko to his destination and serve in that god's name.
Ninigi told Amenouzume to bring Sarutahiko to his destination and serve in that god's name.
Ninigi told Amenouzume to bring Sarutahiko to his destination and serve in that god's name.

sen.j: それで、サルタヒコの名を負って猿女君と言うのである。
sen.e: Thus, the name is Sarume no kimi, borrowing from Sarutahiko's name.
Thus, Sarume no kimi was named after Sarutahiko.
sen.cmt: ほぼ全文を原文の内容に則して変更
sen.e: Thus, Sarume no kimi was named after Sarutahiko.

sen.j: サルタヒコは、阿耶訶（あざか）で漁をしている時に比良夫貝に手を挟まれて溺れてしまった。
sen.e: Sarutahiko got his hand caught in hirafu-gai shellfish and drowned when he was fishing at Azaka.
Sarutahiko got his hand caught in hirafu-gai shellfish and drowned when he was fishing at Azaka.
Sarutahiko got his hand caught in hirafu-gai shellfish and drowned when he was fishing at Azaka.

sen.j: 底に沈んでいる時の名をソコドクミタマと言い、泡粒が立ち上る時の名をツブタツミタマと言い、その泡が裂ける時の名をアワサクミタマと言う。
sen.e: His name was Sokodokumitama when he was submerged at the bottom, Tsubutatsumitama when the bubbles were rising up, and Awasakumitama when these bubbles burst.
His name was Sokodokumitama when he was submerged at the bottom, Tsubutatsumitama when the bubbles were rising up, and Awasakumitama when these bubbles burst.
His name was Sokodokumitama when he was submerged at the bottom, Tsubutatsumitama when the bubbles were rising up, and Awasakumitama when these bubbles burst.

sen.j: アメノウズメがサルタヒコを送って帰ってきて、あらゆる魚を集めて天津神の御子（ニニギ）に仕えるかと聞いた。
sen.e: Amenouzume returned after bringing Satutahiko to his destination, and she gathered all the fishes and asked if they'd serve Amatsukami's son (Ninigi).
Amenouzume returned after bringing Satutahiko to his destination, and she gathered all the fishes and asked if they would serve Amatsukami's son (Ninigi).
sen.cmt: they'dの短縮形をthey wouldに変更
sen.e: Amenouzume returned after bringing Satutahiko to his destination, and she gathered all the fishes and asked if they would serve Amatsukami's son (Ninigi).

sen.j: 多くの魚が仕えると答えた中でナマコだけが答えなかった。
sen.e: Among the many fishes that answered that they would serve Ninigi, only the sea cucumbers did not answer.
Among the many fishes that answered that they would serve Ninigi, only the sea cucumbers did not answer.
Among the many fishes that answered that they would serve Ninigi, only the sea cucumbers did not answer.

sen.j: そこでアメノウズメは「この口は答えない口か」と言って小刀で口を裂いてしまった。
sen.e: Then Amenouzume said 'is this mouth a mouth that does not answer?' and she slit the mouth with a short sword.
Then Amenouzume said 'is this mouth a mouth that does not answer?' and she slit the mouth with a short sword.
Then Amenouzume said 'is this mouth a mouth that does not answer?' and she slit the mouth with a short sword.

sen.j: それで今でもナマコの口は裂けているのである。
sen.e: This is why the sea cucumber's mouth still looks like it is slit open.
This is why the sea cucumber's mouth still looks like it is slit open.
This is why the sea cucumber's mouth still looks like it is slit open.

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメとイワナガヒメ
sen.e: Konohana sakuyabime and Iwanagahime
Konohana sakuyabime and Iwanagahime
Konohana sakuyabime and Iwanagahime

sen.j: ニニギは笠沙の岬で美しい娘に逢った。
sen.e: Ninigi met a beautiful girl at Kasasa no Misaki.
Ninigi met a beautiful girl at Kasasa no Misaki Cape.
sen.cmt: 訳文を理解しやすくするため用語にCapeを追加
sen.e: Ninigi met a beautiful girl at Kasasa no Misaki Cape.

sen.j: 娘はオオヤマツミの子で名をカムアタツヒメ、別名をコノハナノサクヤビメといった。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and her name was Kamuatatsuhime, with an alternate name of Konohana Sakuyabime.
She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and her name was Kamuatatsuhime, with an alternate name of Konohana Sakuyabime.
She was a daughter of Oyamatsumi, and her name was Kamuatatsuhime, with an alternate name of Konohana Sakuyabime.

sen.j: ニニギが求婚すると父に訊くようにと言われた。
sen.e: When Ninigi proposed to her to marry him she told him to ask her father.
When Ninigi proposed to her to marry him she told him to ask her father.
When Ninigi proposed to her to marry him she told him to ask her father.

sen.j: そこで父であるオオヤマツミに尋ねると大変喜び、姉のイワナガヒメとともに差し出した。
sen.e: When he asked her father, Oyamatsumi, he became very happy, and he also presented to him her sister, Iwanagahime.
When he asked her father, Oyamatsumi, he became very happy, and he also presented to him her sister, Iwanagahime.
When he asked her father, Oyamatsumi, he became very happy, and he also presented to him her sister, Iwanagahime.

sen.j: しかし、イワナガヒメはとても醜かったので、ニニギはイワナガヒメを送り返し、コノハナノサクヤビメだけと結婚した。
sen.e: However, Iwanagahime was very ugly, and Ninigi sent Iwanagahime home and married only Konohana Sakuyabime.
However, Iwanagahime was very ugly, and Ninigi sent Iwanagahime home and married only Konohana Sakuyabime.
However, Iwanagahime was very ugly, and Ninigi sent Iwanagahime home and married only Konohana Sakuyabime.

sen.j: オオヤマツミは「私が娘二人を一緒に差し上げたのは、イワナガヒメを妻にすれば天津神の御子（ニニギ）の命は岩のように永遠のものとなり、コノハナノサクヤビメを妻にすれば木の花が咲くように繁栄するだろうとうけい（うけひ）をしたからである。コノハナノサクヤビメだけと結婚したので、天津神の御子の命は木の花のようにはかなくなるだろう」（「我之女二並立奉者有因 使石長姬者 天神御子之命雖雪零風吹 恆可如石而常堅不動坐 亦使木花之佐久夜姬者 如木花之榮榮坐 因立此誓者而使二女貢進 今汝令返石長姬而獨留木花之佐久夜姬 故今後天神御子之御壽者 將如木花之稍縱即逝矣」『古事記』）と言った。
sen.e: Oyamatsumi said, 'The reason why I offered my two daughters together was that I made a vow that by making Iwanagahime your wife, the son of Amatsukami (Ninigi)'s life would be as eternal as a rock, and by making Konohana sakuyabime your wife you would prosper as a tree flowers. Because you married only Konohana sakuyabime, the son of Amatsukami's life will be short just as flowers on a tree' (the "Kojiki").

Oyamatsumi said, 'The reason why I offered my two daughters together was that I made a vow that by making Iwanagahime your wife, the son of Amatsukami (Ninigi)'s life would be as eternal as a rock, and by making Konohana sakuyabime your wife, you would prosper as a tree flowers. Because you married only Konohana sakuyabime, the son of Amatsukami's life will be short just as flowers on a tree' (the "Kojiki").
sen.cmt: Konohana sakuyabime your wifeの後にコンマを追加
sen.e: Oyamatsumi said, 'The reason why I offered my two daughters together was that I made a vow that by making Iwanagahime your wife, the son of Amatsukami (Ninigi)'s life would be as eternal as a rock, and by making Konohana sakuyabime your wife, you would prosper as a tree flowers. Because you married only Konohana sakuyabime, the son of Amatsukami's life will be short just as flowers on a tree' (the "Kojiki").

sen.j: それで、現在でも天皇の寿命は長くないのである。
sen.e: This is why emperors have short lives.
This is why emperors have short lives, even now.
This is why emperors have short lives, even now.

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメの出産
sen.e: Konohana sakuyabime giving birth.
Konohana sakuyabime giving birth.
Konohana sakuyabime giving birth.

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメは一夜を共にしただけで身篭った。
sen.e: Konohana sakuyabime became pregnant overnight.
Konohana sakuyabime became pregnant overnight.
Konohana sakuyabime became pregnant overnight.

sen.j: それを聞いたニニギは、「たった一夜で身篭る筈はない。それは国津神の子だろう」（「佐久夜毘賣 一宿哉妊 此胎必非我子而為國津神之子」『古事記』）と言った。
sen.e: When Ninigi heard this he said, 'There is no way you can get pregnant overnight. The child must be a Kunitsukami's' (the "Kojiki").
When Ninigi heard this, he said, 'There is no way you can get pregnant overnight. The child must be a Kunitsukami's' (the "Kojiki").
sen.cmt: thisと heの間にコンマを挿入
sen.e: When Ninigi heard this, he said, 'There is no way you can get pregnant overnight. The child must be a Kunitsukami's' (the "Kojiki").

sen.j: コノハナノサクヤビメは、「この子が国津神の子なら、産む時に無事ではないでしょう。天津神の子なら、無事でしょう」（「吾妊之子 若國津神之子者 幸難產 若為天津神之御子者 幸產」『古事記』）と誓約をした。
sen.e: Konohana Sakuyabime made a vow saying, 'If this is a child of a Kunitsukami, then it will not be a safe birth. If the child is Amatsukami's, then the birth will be safe' (the "Kojiki").
Konohana Sakuyabime made a vow saying, 'If this is a child of a Kunitsukami, then it will not be a safe birth. If the child is Amatsukami's, then the birth will be safe' (the "Kojiki").
Konohana Sakuyabime made a vow saying, 'If this is a child of a Kunitsukami, then it will not be a safe birth. If the child is Amatsukami's, then the birth will be safe' (the "Kojiki").

sen.j: そして、戸のない御殿を建ててその中に入り、産む時になって御殿に火をつけた。
sen.e: She then built a palace without a door, entered into it, and she set the palace on fire when it was time to give birth.
She then built a palace without a door, entered into it, and she set the palace on fire when it was time to give birth.
She then built a palace without a door, entered into it, and she set the palace on fire when it was time to give birth.

sen.j: 天津神の子であったので、無事に三柱の子を産み終えた。
sen.e: Since the children were Amatsukami's the three children were born safely.
Since the children were Amatsukami's the three children were born safely.
Since the children were Amatsukami's the three children were born safely.

sen.j: 火が盛んに燃えている時に生んだ子をホデリ、火が弱くなった時の子をホスセリ、火が消えた時の子をホオリ、またの名をアマツヒコヒコホホデミという。
sen.e: The child that was born when the fire was burning fiercely was named Hoderi, the child that was born when the fire lost its force was named Hosuseri, and the child that was born when the fire went out was named Hoori, also known as Amatsuhikohikohohodemi.

The child that was born when the fire was burning fiercely was named Hoderi, the child that was born when the fire lost its force was named Hosuseri, and the child that was born when the fire went out was named Hoori, also known as Amatsuhikohikohohodemi.

The child that was born when the fire was burning fiercely was named Hoderi, the child that was born when the fire lost its force was named Hosuseri, and the child that was born when the fire went out was named Hoori, also known as Amatsuhikohikohohodemi.

sen.j: なお、皇子の出生の順番は、文献により異なっている。
sen.e: The order of the birth of the princes differs depending on the source.
The order of the birth of the princes differs depending on the source.
The order of the birth of the princes differs depending on the source.
